title: Yorkshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: transgender inmate who died in armley jail 'let down ' by nhs , prison and family .
trains return to normal after disruption between sheffield and london .
three charged over leeds woodland death .
york city prepare to take on macclesfield for fa trophy at wembley .
bradford city to take on millwall at wembley to win promotion to championship .
homeless in leeds urged to register to vote .
rotherham sex abuse victim praises bbc drama three girls .
college wildlife park opens near york .

documents.title: our five top stories today
text: well that 's all from us for today , we 'll be back on monday from 06:30 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for yorkshire .
before we go , let 's look back at some of our top stories from today :
see you on monday
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: community bid to buy historic leeds pub fails
text: a bid by a community group in leeds to buy a historic pub in the city has failed .
the cardigan arms on kirkstall road is one of only 260 pubs in the country that has been `` identified as having heritage of significant importance '' , but has fallen on hard times recently .

the previous owners have sold it to kirkstall brewery who say `` i look forward to bringing the same sense of pride in restoring and operating the cardigan as we have to our current pub , the kirkstall bridge .
the group had managed to raise £ 130,000 in pledges and say that all cheques will be returned .
it does remain an asset of local community value , we 'll have to wait and see what the new owner does with it . ''

documents.title: travel update : problems on m62 eastbound
text: bad news for the friday getaway , we 've got one lane closed on the m62 eastbound between j29 and j30 .
there 's been a multi-vehicle crash and emergency services are on scene .
highways england say that they expect the road to remain blocked for at least the next two hours .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: leeds nightclub shooting : do you recognise this man ?
text: police investigating a shooting at a leeds nightclub last year have released more cctv images of a man they want to speak to .
a 42-year-old man was shot and seriously injured outside nitetrax nightclub on chapeltown road , in the early hours of 29 august last year .
two men appeared in court last week charged with attempted murder in relation to the incident and were remanded in custody to appear at leeds crown court in june .
this was a very serious incident where the victim was left badly injured as a result of the criminal use of firearms . ''

documents.title: wheatbag causes house fire in leeds
text: an elderly man had a lucky escape from a house after after a wheatbag caught fire in his microwave .
crews were called to rawdon at about 10:45 this morning where they found this microwave on fire .
wheatbags are those things that you heat up in the microwave and then they keep you warm , some use them as pain relief .
the man was treated for smoke inhalation , here 's a safety guide from west yorkshire fire and rescue .

documents.title: police hunt escaped york prisoner
text: police are hunting a man in york who is wanted on recall to prison and `` considered to be dangerous '' .
mark anthony ainsley , 27 , was arrested on wednesday night , but managed to escape from custody during a visit to york hospital .
the police helicopter was out in the clifton area of the city yesterday , as part of the search to find him .
officers are urging anyone who knows where he may be to get in touch .

documents.title: going back , giving back returns with a yorkshire episode
text: on monday morning a second series of going back , giving back is on bbc one .
it 's hosted by aled jones and the first programme follows angela knowles , who was one of the original calendar girls from the yorkshire dales :
the first episode is on bbc one on monday at 09:15 .
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: bradford actor arif javid on the movie being billed as the uk 's first asian rom-com
text: bradford actor arif javid on the movie being billed as the uk 's first asian rom-com

documents.title: suspected drink-driver arrested after minor crash
text: we seem to say this a lot on this blog , but this is why you do n't drink and drive :
this minor crash happened at halifax railway station , the driver was three times over the drinking and driving limit police said .

documents.title: police close house after drugs offences reported
text: south yorkshire police have taken action to enforce a residential closure notice at a property on princess crescent in the edlington area of doncaster .
officers issued the notice at the address preventing anyone from visiting or entering the premises , after a number of reports relating to drugs offences and other illegal activity were received .
i hope our proactive approach and action taken demonstrates our commitment to work with partners and local authorities to bring offenders to justice and create a safer doncaster for everyone ''
author: Ronan Sully
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: crop a load of this : police need name for new recruit
text: if you joined us yesterday you 'll have been treated to such punning as the `` long farm of the law '' and slow-speed police chase with new `` crop car . ''
the excuse for such poor humour was the news that the latest vehicle to take up space in north yorkshire 's police garage is a tractor .
it 's not an operational police vehicle , instead it 's making guest appearances at country shows as part of police efforts to engage with rural communities .
but the one thing it does n't have is a name - yet anyway !
north yorkshire police are running a competition to find one .
today , taking a softly softly approach ( a tv reference for the older reader ) police have revealed the view from the front :
and the view from the front now it 's done !
hey , can i come and see your police tractor for the farming today prog on bbc radio 4 ?
yes if you like .
excellent , if you follow me i 'll dm you and we can sort something out .
thanks , caz

# thuglife
yeah quite a few forces have them now good for rural areas where livestock gets stolen
with siren
ds la nuit ça doit faire peur ! !
c'est un monstre se tracteur
what use is this tractor ?
how will it help catch criminals ?
mean machine , oh arr !
i spot the new vehicle for the lamport show !
looks good that should scare the crims
omg do not park that in lincolnshire it will get nicked lol
what is the total price of the tractor ?
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: yorkshire olympian collects his mbe
text: congratulations to yorkshire diver jack laugher who has been to buckingham palace today to collect his mbe from prince charles .
jack ( below right ) received his medal alongside his diving partner chris mears , with whom he won gold in the synchronised three metre springboard at the rio olym last summer .
jack says receiving the honour is something he 'll remember for the rest of his life .
congratulations chris mears & jack laugher on your # mbes !
the diving duo won gold together in the 3m springboard at # rio2016
first ever british gold medalists and also reigning world champion , plus a lifetime of dedication to their sport .
not `` just '' a medal .
they 're not paid .
they only get money from winning competitions and rely on that to live and fund their training .

un gran abrazo desde # mexico # divers # teamgb

well done lads .

so proud

BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: police supporting harrogate pride event
text: a week of events in harrogate to celebrate diversity comes to a peak tomorrow with a pride in diversity parade down montpellier hill followed by a party in the valley gardens with live bands .
north yorkshire police are supporting the event and have even had special epaulettes made for the occasion :
more details of what 's in store can be found here .
epaulettes fresh in for # harrogatepride this weekend !
planning to be on the parade in the morning under the humanists banner .
also faith debate tonight
it should be fun .
i 'll be on first aid .
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: watch : bradford fans ahead of wembley visit
text: bradford city are 90 minutes away from the championship after making the play-off final against millwall at wembley .
let 's get you in the mood by meeting some excited fans :
radio leeds has full commentary tomorrow from 1100 with match commentary from 1500 on their fm 92.4 and freeview channel 719 .
author: BBC West Yorkshire Sport

documents.title: watch : york 's lemur love triangle at new wildlife park
text: today is the official opening of the askham bryan wildlife & conservation park .
the park 's at askham bryan college , near york , where students can study to be animal keepers or education officers in zoos .
armadillos , chinchillas , skunks , meerkats and lemurs are just some of the animals being studied and they 're also on display to the public .
i was there earlier and encountered something i never expected too - a lemur love triangle !
the new park is part of a £ 6.8m development project which has seen the construction of an animal management centre at the college , which has a wetland area and farm animals .
author: Cara Thorpe
BBC Radio York News

documents.title: 'ello 'ello 'ello to the new bobbies
text: south yorkshire 's assistant chief constable david hartley has welcomed 18 new officers to the force .
the student officers are a mix of external and internal candidates who will be taking up various positions from pcso 's , the special constabulary and communications .
the student officers are now taking a week 's leave prior to joining their local policing teams .
the students all worked hard but we had some fun as well .
the training staff would like to wish them the very best for the next phase of their careers ''
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: two jailed for nine years over quad bike deaths
text: two men have been jailed for nine years each for killing four people who were riding on a quad bike in west yorkshire .
daniel raynor ( left ) , 24 , from barnsley was sentenced to nine years in prison as was matthew todd , 23 also from barnsley .
they both admitted four charges of causing death by dangerous driving .
ryan beal , 20 , brandon brown , 20 , alexandra binns , 18 , and terrie kirby , 16 , were killed when the vehicle was hit by a nissan 350z moving at 140mph .
during the trial , prosecutor kama melly qc said the nissan was one of a number of vehicles taking part in a high-speed race when the crash happened on 27 september .
a jury was told how the four who died were out celebrating miss kirby 's birthday when the quad bike was hit by the nissan travelling in the same direction .

documents.title: lancashire v yorkshire : latest from the roses match
text: the afternoon session is under way in the roses cricket match where yorkshire are batting against lancashire .
the white rose have lost three wickets so far in the match , with peter handscomb the latest man to fall lbw to mclaren .
the big news , though , from old trafford is that england bowler james anderson has left the field with an injury .
you can listen to ball-by-ball commentary of the game via this link .
worrying scenes for @ twitterid at old trafford .
@ jimmy9 leaves the field mid over after taking a fall .
the season began on 28th march .
that was nearly 2 months ago
oh jimmy plzz take rest and get well soon
hope nothing too serious jimmy - from a yorkshire fan !
hope he 's alright , although if need be , @ twitterid have backups to turn to !
oh no @ twitterid this time i do n't want to see that you need rest so take rest please please i do n't want injuries will destroy your career
oh well long past his sale by date
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: mother of transgender inmate claims prison 'responsible ' for daughter 's death
text: the mother of transgender woman inmate vikki thompson has claimed hmp leeds was responsible for her death .
an inquest jury concluded miss thompson , who was found dead in her cell at the jail on 13 november , was let down by the nhs , prison service and her family .
but they ruled it was right she was held in a male jail and that she did not intend to take her own life .
the jury heard miss thompson ( above , right ) was placed on an hourly suicide watch when she arrived at hmp leeds .
her mother lisa harrison said : `` i do not feel that the prison fully appreciated vikki 's vulnerabilities and i believe their lack of insight has resulted in her death . ''
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: deadline nears for white rose awards nominations
text: fancy being recognised in one of the uk 's biggest tourism awards ?
get cracking because time is running out for businesses to enter this year 's welcome to yorkshire 's white rose awards .
next friday is the deadline and organisers say last year 's winners `` reported a boom in business '' following their success .
if you 'd like to enter , click here .
as always , we will be recognising the very best of yorkshire 's talent and celebrating the county 's thriving economy . ''

documents.title: head ruled out of yorkshire 's t20 blast
text: head ruled out of yorkshire 's t20 blast

documents.title: listen : general election - chancellor in york
text: the chancellor , philip hammond , has been in york today .
he visited netsells , a web design company in the city , where he said employment is his `` main priority '' when it comes to yorkshire :

documents.title: sheffield/london train route update
text: the good news ahead of the friday rush hour is that all train services between sheffield and london have returned to normal .
a signalling fault near luton this morning triggered delays and cancellations along the line but the operator east midlands trains has just posted this update :
so , trains heading south from sheffield to all stations into london st pancras international are running to timetable .
there is still one cancellation on the northbound line :
the 1326 and 1329 departures towards yorkshire are scheduled to depart on time .
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: big ben 's final strike
text: all week i 've been out across south yorkshire armed with a giant cardboard cut-out of big ben .
why ?
to hear from you about what issues are important ahead of the general election .
last stop , sheffield :
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: firefighter reunited with woman who rescued him from the bradford city fire
text: a firefighter has been reunited with the woman who rescued him from the bradford city fire disaster when he was just six years old .
author: Bradford Telegraph and Argus

text: what a sight for york city fans as they head to london to see their team challenge for the fa trophy :

documents.title: decorative 'bomb ' falls off bike - roads closed for two hours
text: a biker in leeds caused a road to be closed this morning after this `` decorative ornament '' fell off his motorcycle :
spen lane in west park was shut for over two hours after someone came across the object lying on a grass verge .
bomb squad officers were called in just after 09:00 this morning , but soon after a man called police to say that the deadly looking item `` had fallen off his bike '' .
the roads around the area have now been reopened .
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: transgender prisoner 'let down by prison , nhs and family '
text: a transgender woman inmate who died in a men 's prison while on remand was let down by the nhs , prison service and her family , an inquest jury has concluded .
vikki thompson , 21 , from keighley , was found dead in her cell at hmp leeds on 13 november 2015 with a ligature around her neck .
but the jury at the two-week inquest in wakefield concluded it was right she was held in a male jail and that she did not intend to take her own life .
more attention should have been paid to vikki as a transgender woman with a history from a previous stay in the prison .
throughout her chaotic life , vikki has been let down by various departments including the nhs , leeds community healthcare nhs trust , the prison service and also by her family . ''
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: watch : around roundhay in 20 seconds
text: if you 've ever wanted to do the full tour of roundhay park in leeds , but not had the motivation , energy or the time , you 're in for a speedy treat .
seven hundred acres in 20 seconds - press play and hang on tight !

documents.title: motorist held after 'erratic ' driving
text: a car being driven erratically in sheffield was brought to a stop by police officers last night .
the incident came to an end just before 22:00 bst , when a grey car was stopped on a pavement near st mary 's roundabout in the city centre .
south yorkshire police have told us that they were made aware of erratic driving on the m18 and that the driver in question failed to stop for police vehicles .
a pursuit then took place and the car was tactically halted by officers .
nobody was injured and the driver was then detained .
author: Oli Constable
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: listen : sheffield man tells lifelong search for father
text: when did you first meet your father ?
well , for denton wilson from sheffield he had to wait 42 years .
he was told his dad had died , but he was n't convinced , so he went to jamaica to investigate .
they finally met , but when he returned to the uk he received a phone call that changed his life :
author: Paulette Edwards
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: wakefield man charged with historical rape offence
text: a man from wakefield has been charged with a rape which happened almost 20 years ago .
anthony mottram , aged 48 , of weeland road in sharlston common is due to appear before leeds magistrates court later today charged with the rape of a 16-year-old girl in bradford in june 1997 .
he has also been charged with four counts of indecent assault and one count of possessing an offensive weapon .

documents.title: mass brawl at leeds united venue prompts boxing ban
text: boxing matches at a leeds venue will not be allowed to carry on after a mass brawl in february .
the fight , involving about 40 people , broke out at the centenary pavilion , at leeds united 's stadium at elland road .
people threw chairs at a `` white collar '' boxing event and three people suffered minor injuries and were taken to hospital .
leeds city council has now changed the venue 's licence so that boxing events ca n't take place there after police spoke to a council committee .
the result will protect the public , and in particular children who were present at the latest problem event . ''

documents.title: listen : war of the roses - yorkshire v lancashire ball-by-ball commentary
text: the first four-day roses match of the season is under way .
it 's yorkshire 's county championship game against lancashire at old trafford .
it 's the visitors who have won the toss and elected to bat .
you can listen to ball-by-ball commentary by simply clicking this link .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: watch : free beer for sheffield voters
text: a sheffield pub is offering drinkers a free pint if they register to vote .
the city centre 's red deer , on pitt street , is taking part in the national 'vote this year get free beer ' scheme .
all you need to do is flash your polling card to bar staff and up your free drink .
the scheme 's specifically targeting 18-24-year olds , as in the last general election less than half of that age group voted .
author: Oli Constable
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: woman threatened by man in skull mask in leeds
text: do you recognise this man ?
police want to speak to him after a woman in leeds was threatened by a man in a skull mask with a large knife .
it happened on 19 march in bramley poplar court , on poplar way .
the man then just walked away .
this was a frightening ordeal for the victim , thankfully she was not injured during the incident , but very shaken up . ''

documents.title: death announced of ex-york city player and scorer of fastest hat-trick - tommy ross
text: the scorer of the fastest hat-trick in football , tommy ross , has died , one of his former football clubs has said .
mr ross held the guinness world record for three goals scored in 90 seconds while he was playing for ross county against nairn county in november 1964 .
his death has been announced by tain club , st duthus fc , which he managed .
he was 70 .
inver-born tommy ross also played for york city fc from 1967 - 1969 , as inside forward , before later returning to the highlands .

documents.title: cute alert : college wildlife park opens near york
text: i 've been for a walk on the wild side this morning , because today is the official opening of the askham bryan wildlife & conservation park .
the park 's at askham bryan college , near york , where students can study to be animal keepers or education officers in zoos .
armadillos , chinchillas , skunks , meerkats and lemurs are just some of the animals being studied and they 're also on display to the public .
i 've been for a sneak peek and snapped these two beautiful boy lemurs .
that 's the fabulous fred up above and down below is cute kags .
it is part of a £ 6.8m development project which has seen the construction of an animal management centre at the college , which has a wetland area and farm animals , including alpacas .
author: Cara Thorpe
BBC Radio York News

documents.title: it 'suits ' sheffield to help unemployed to find work
text: a charity which gives out smart clothes says it 's helped more than 100 people in it 's first year .
the suit works on mowbray street in sheffield kits out unemployed men for free to help make them feel dapper for interviews .
they take donations , upcycle them and then pass them on to people who need them .
vanda kewley joined me earlier to discuss the success of her first twelve months :
author: Kat Cowan
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: north yorkshire diesel drivers encouraged to park outside towns
text: drivers of older diesel vehicles in north yorkshire could be encouraged to park outside the towns of malton and norton , to help cut air pollution .
it 's one of the recommendations in a report looking at ways to improve air quality .
more houses will be built in malton and norton over the coming years and with it will come more traffic - adding to air pollution .
to tackle this , consultants for ryedale district council suggest more take-up of electric car and encouraging drivers of older diesel cars to park out of town and then walk in .
author: Mike Kemp
Reporter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: sheffield to london train update
text: i 'm keeping an eye across any updates that come through regarding an earlier signal fault near luton , which is affecting train services between sheffield and london st pancras .
the good news from operator east midlands trains is that services are leaving sheffield on-time ; it 's further south where issues remain and that you 're likely to experience delays :
the problem now is that staff and trains are not quite where they should be , so their best guess currently is that it will be around midday before a 'normal ' service resumes .
until then you 're best option for travelling to london from sheffield by train is to travel to doncaster and connect with virgin trains east coast services to london kings cross .
do n't worry , we have already arranged for your ticket to be accepted by the other train operators ''
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: watch : 'mum keeps me right ' - york pupils unique dementia film
text: children at a school in york have made a film that takes a unique look at dementia .
created especially for dementia awareness week , the short feature shows pupils from carr junior school .
talking about how their mothers help them remember things .
but the film says this is not the same for older people with dementia :

documents.title: listen : homeless in leeds urged to register to vote
text: homeless people in leeds are being urged to register to vote , with three days to go now until the deadline .
people with no fixed address can fill out a special form called a declaration of local connection and put an address where they mostly spend their time .
normally , people must state a home address when applying to join the electoral register - an obvious problem for homeless people .
chris fields from st georges crypt is encouraging people to use their services and address on the form :

documents.title: train disruption likely until lunchtime
text: if you 're planning on taking a train between london st pancras and sheffield this morning , you 're going to be suffering delays .
east midlands trains have released this update :

although an earlier signalling fault near luton has been fixed by network rail , the knock-on effect to services is still on-going , with a normal service not expected to be in operation for several hours .
according to the live departure boards , trains are leaving sheffield on-time , but there are delays further south .
the advice for passengers heading to london from south yorkshire is to travel to doncaster where tickets can be used on virgin trains east coast services to london kings cross .
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: friday 's yorkshire weather - it 's a bit wet !
text: there 's quite a lot of the damp stuff about this morning .
it 's cooler too , with some brisk winds .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Sara Thornton
BBC Weather

documents.title: travel update : trains between sheffield and london
text: national rail enquiries have released an update for an alternative route if you 're heading to or from london st pancras international from sheffield this morning .
a signalling fault between luton and london means trains are n't running in that stretch .

the advice if you 're heading to the capital by train from sheffield is to take transpennine express , northern or crosscountry services to doncaster to connect with virgin trains east coast services to london kings cross .
these services will accept east midlands trains tickets until the incident is fixed .
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: cyber crime unit advising leeds businesses
text: the yorkshire and humber regional cyber crime unit will be talking to businesses and other organisations today about protecting themselves against ransomware .
the event in leeds follows last weekend 's cyber attacks , where several nhs hospitals and surgeries across our region , including the york teaching hospital , had their computers hacked .
staff were unable to access patient records , appointments and prescriptions .
there remains some mystery as to how the campaign was first launched .
experts are looking for what they call `` patient zero '' - the first computer to be infected - to understand the method of delivery .

from that point on , the malware spread virulently , because it looked for computers to spread to within an organisation , but also looked across the internet for other computers it could connect to and infect .

documents.title: traffic and travel : sheffield - london trains - major disruption
text: trains between sheffield and london are being affected by a signalling fault which is causing major disruption between luton and london st pancras .
network rail says its ' expecting the thameslink service between brighton and bedford to be disrupted until at least 13:00 .
here 's the departure and arrivals board at sheffield so you can keep an eye on things .

documents.title: the viking legend rediscovered in york
text: i 've been trying to imagine myself as a viking - i 've got the facial hair at least - as a major new exhibition opens at the yorkshire museum called `` rediscover the legend '' .
i 've had a close look at some of the exhibits and spoken to natalie buy , the exhibition 's curator .
she told me about the `` york helmet , '' one of the best preserved examples of a helmet of its type :
author: Jonathan Cowap
Presenter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: on the rails in yorkshire
text: if you 're planning on heading to the station this morning , everything seems to be running smoothly with no major delays to services across yorkshire so far .
of course this could change , so if you are getting the train to work , click on the links below to keep up-to-date with the live departure boards for :
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: 'it showed the brutality ' : rotherham sex abuse victim praises bbc drama
text: a survivor of child sexual exploitation in rotherham says she 's pleased the television drama three girls , showed the brutal reality of child sexual exploitation ( cse ) .
the programme tells the story of three children who were victims in the grooming and sex trafficking case in rochdale in 2012 , with strong echoes of what happened in rotherham .
the final episode went out last night .
this victim says portraying the subject in a drama also means more people will watch the programme :

documents.title: yorkshire 's friday weather
text: cloudy with persistent rain this morning , perhaps locally heavy , more especially the east .
a bit brighter in the south later .
feeling cool with some brisk coastal winds .
tonight cloudy and damp conditions will persist , although the rain should become lighter and more patchy later .
the brisk coastal winds should also ease .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: listen : 'we 're going to the championship ' : confident bantams fans wembley walk
text: bradford city are in london looking to win promotion to the championship at wembley .
the city players ' coach left the cedar court hotel in bradford for london yesterday afternoon as the club builds up for the clash .
if the bantams can overcome millwall , it 'll be their first time in the second tier since 2004 .
these fans in manningham are confident their team can perform on the big day :
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: listen : despair to delight ? - york fans head to wembley
text: thousands of york city supporters are hoping despair will turn to delight at wembley this weekend , in the final of the fa trophy .
it 's city 's fifth trip to wembley in the last eight years , but it comes at the end of a a disappointing season .
city are playing macclesfield .
winning the trophy would be a huge boost after the heartbreak of relegation last month .
manager , gary mills , says he 's hoping to reward the fans support with a win :

documents.title: murder charges after woman 's body found in leeds woods
text: three people have been charged in connection with the death of a woman found dead in woodland near leeds .
the body of sinead wooding , 26 , was discovered by joggers near alwoodley crags car park in stairfoot lane on sunday .
police said akshar ali , 26 , of kings road , leeds , and yasmin ahmed , 27 , of reginald mount , leeds , have been charged with her murder .
asim ali , 20 , of kings road , has been charged with assisting an offender .
all three are due to appear at leeds magistrates ' court on friday .

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage across yorkshire
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live in yorkshire on friday 19 may 2017 .
we 'll be with you throughout the day with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates .
you 're welcome to join in as always .
like bbc weather watcher , watergypsyrach , who sent in a pic which combines two of my favourite meteorological phenomenon in one - a red sky and a rainbow .
if you snap anything interesting , which you 'd like to show off to the rest of yorkshire , you can send it in by simply clicking here .
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire
